milestone.title: v1.15.0
milestone.description:
This release fixes a vulnerability where Syncthing and the relay server can crash due to malformed relay protocol messages (CVE-2021-21404); see https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/security/advisories/GHSA-x462-89pf-6r5h.

This release updates the CLI to use subcommands and adds the subcommands `cli` (previously standalone `stcli` utility) and `decrypt` (for offline verifying and decrypting encrypted folders).

With this release we invite everyone to test the "untrusted (encrypted) devices" feature. You should not use it yet on important production data. Thus UI controls are hidden behind a feature flag. For more information, visit: 
https://forum.syncthing.net/t/testing-untrusted-encrypted-devices/16470

issue.body:
### Include required information

 - Syncthing v1.14.0, Linux (64-bit Intel/AMD)
 - Browser Chrome 88.0.4324.182 (Official Build) (64-bit)

### How to reproduce

* Go to __[any shared folder]__ :arrow_right: __Edit__ 
* Observe tab _"Ignore Patterns"_
* Go to __Settings__ :arrow_right: __Default Configuration__ :arrow_right: __Edit Folder Defaults__
* Observe _no_ tab _"Ignore Patterns"_ (by design I guess)
* Go to __[any shared folder]__ :arrow_right: __Edit__ again
* Observe previously visible tab _"Ignore Patterns"_ is now gone.

---

I found this bug when checking the proper names to mention in this feature request: https://github.com/syncthing/syncthing/issues/7428

body:
Just an FYI, but not something that I would think invalidates this feature request.
You can use a separate, syncable text file that has your default ignore pattern, and reference that in the .stignore file using the `#ignore` syntax. For exact usage, see the [documentation](https://docs.syncthing.net/users/ignoring.html).

issue.title: Could we have a .stsharedignore file that gets synchronized between all the devices?

issue.body:
I want to ignore a set of files on all my nodes.
Right now, the only "half workaround" is adding the line 
#include .stglobalignore

To the file `.stignore`,  but I have to manually add this line in all my devices and that is not always easy to achieve. 

Would be possible to have a second ignore file that gets synchronized between devices?

PS: One options that I saw in the forums was to always create a `.stignore`  file with that line in all shared directories.  If `.stglobalignore` is not present, nothing happens and if exits it works as intended.

issue.title: lib, gui: Default ignores for new folders (fixes #7428)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
Adds default ignores. Those are applied when a folder is auto-accepted. When adding a folder in the web UI, it checks if there is a pre-existing `.stignore` file at the new folder path (through a new `/rest/system/readignores` endpoint), and if not uses the defaults.

The defaults are stored in the config folder in a file named `default-stignore`. The can be modified through the `/rest/db/defaultignores` endpoint. `/rest/db` hardly is the right place for this, but `/rest/db/ignores` already exists. And it's not obvious to me where to put it: Putting it into an own group feels like overkill (`/rest/ignores/folder/folder-id` and `/rest/ignores/default`) and moving to `/rest/system` isn't much better than `/rest/db`. Suggestions for a better endpoint and filename are welcome :) 

Testing: I can change defaults and they appear when adding a new folder.
